title: Pale Blue raises $7.5 million to mass produce water vapor thrusters
summary: Japanese small satellite thruster developer Pale Blue has raised $7.5 million to establish a mass production facility for its water vapor propulsion systems.

title: Musk: “Decent Chance” of Starship Reaching Space Next Time
summary: Elon Musk thinks Starship has a “decent chance” of reaching space on the next launch after he changed the design of how the first and second stages separate. On the […]

title: Starship satellite launches a year away
summary: SpaceX Chief Executive Elon Musk says it will be about a year before the company’s new Starship vehicle will be ready to start launching satellites.

title: Washington reusable rocket startup Stoke Space raises $100 million
summary: Washington-based startup Stoke Space raised $100 million in new funds, the company announced Thursday, as it aims to develop a fully reusable rocket called “Nova.”

title: India hopes reforms will make it a global space hub
summary: The Indian government is continuing a series of reforms aimed at increasing private involvement in the space sector and attracting global capital.

title: Investing in Space: Trust NASA’s private orbital station development process
summary: “Refining strategies and evolving partnerships are part of the process.”

title: Space Force releases final call for bids for national security launch services
summary: The U.S. Space Force on Oct. 4 released two solicitations for the next round of national security launch contracts, known as National Security Space Launch Phase 3.

title: Russia blames Luna-25 crash on computer glitch
summary: Russia says its first lunar lander mission in nearly half a century crashed in August because of faulty commands in an onboard computer during a maneuver.

title: NASA expands purchase of commercial Earth-observation data with latest award
summary: Airbus DS Geo, Capella Space, GHGSat, Maxar, PlanetiQ, Spire Global and Umbra were selected under the fixed-price, indefinite delivery, indefinite quantity contract to provide Earth observation data and services in support of NASA research.

title: LMI gets $98 million contract for space wargaming software
summary: The U.S. Air Force awarded the Logistics Management Institute, known as LMI, a $98 million contract for modeling and simulation software to analyze warfighting missions in space.
